Comment 2: 
this (passing 1<<64 to a function) seems impossible to achieve without language
change (unless perhaps the 2nd parameter changes type to a float).

that is, rand.Int will have to accept untyped integer constants larger than 64-bit,
but what type should that be?
if it's a math/big.Int, then we need to add support to implicitly convert integers
into math/big.Int. But if we do add that, people will start asking about more
implicit conversions, and i think this is contradict to the explicitness of Go style.
